title: Episode 64 - "Rio Ghosto"
guest_stars: Ben Stiller, Kevin Smith, Jim Jarmusch

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Scene one, office, day. Mr. White says, "I will stop you." (carriage return) And Mr. Black says, "You won't stop me." (CARRIAGE RETURN) Mr. White says, "Yes, I will stop you." I read that wrong: "Yes, I WILL stop you!" (CARRIAGE RETURN) (PAUSE) Hmm. (PAUSE) Robotic space worm enters, destroys city, The End. (carriage return) (pause) Or is it? (carriage return)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to set) Greetings, I'm Space Ghost, architect of the future. Welcome to the show. (waves) So, how was your weekend, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I, uh, I did some volunteer work over at the orphanage.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I was... (does a double take) Yeah. Well, I was finishing up my screen play, and it's brilliant. Brilliant! Now play me to the Desk.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Some of my director pals are dropping by the studio tonight, and if one of 'em plays his cards right, I'll affix him to my movie.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure I do. Moltar's a director, aren't you, Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, check it out. (throws lever, title card reading "A Moltar Film" scrolls up onto screen, with fanfare music) Ta da. (title card stays in middle of screen)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey Space Ghost, why doncha let me direct your movie?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, Moltar, Moltar, Moltar, Moltar, Moltar, Moltar. (laughs) That's very thoughtful of you. But your specialty is cartoons.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So cartoon's are kid's stuff. I need someone with real adult film experience. I'm sure you understand.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And, would you lose the title card. We're not doing "Three's Company" here.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Sure. (throws lever, title card disappears and trap door opens under Space Ghost's chair)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (thud) (far away voice) Moltar, see me after the show.

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: It's a pleasure to be here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (groaning sounds, climbs up through trap door and into his chair)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It sure looks like a wig.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry about that, Ben. Can we get you anything?

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: I probably could use some coffee.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. (creaking sound in background) Coffee would be good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The kind you would like to do what to, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The kind I'd like to chew off and spit on and spit up and stomp on...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm not finished yet. And slap. And push. And kick. And... push. And... kick.

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, I enjoy the, your ribald sense of humor, that you bring to the show.

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: I think you are a necessary evil...

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: ... if you will, on this show.

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: I think you guys have a great little reparte thing happening.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't mind Zorak, Ben, he's just a squirrel.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (coughs) Uh oh (laughter in background) (coughs again; more background laughter) Hang on. (sneezes) (enthusiastic applause) Thank you!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Anyway, I think you should direct my movie!

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, "Cable Guy 2", starring Space Ghost. You could be the, uh, kooky guy who comes and hooks up the, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let me get with my people, Ben. I'll get back to you on that. Zorak, Moltar, meeting.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ben, we love the idea! So, we're gonna pass. Moltar and Zorak, they just don't share our vision.

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: Okay, thank you. Moltar, and Zorak. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ben, you've been making movies since before you were born. If you could give me any advice about my movie career, what would it be?

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: Um, I would start out with comedy, like you're doing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (writing franticly) Start... out... with... okay, start out with comedy, like I'm doing...

transcript.speaker: Ben Stiller
transcript.dialogue: Do the stand-up, I'd like to see you do some stand-up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (talking on the phone through his communicator) Now, if I'm not completely satisfied, you say I get a full refund. (background reply sounds) That sounds fair. And, still keep my miracle hat? (reply sounds) Yeah, I think I do know a couple of people who may be interested.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: O-kay. Zorak, you want in on this?

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: (appears on monitor) Hey, how are you, Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm on the phone, that's how. Rude. Okay, put me down for six dozen more. (reply sounds) Yeah, I can hold. (hold music)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where'd you get that sweater? It looks cheap. I hate it. (hums along with hold music) (click: reply sounds) Okay then. (phone hangs up, dialtone) Thank you so much. Bye now. Alrighty. Identify yourself, Kevin.

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: Um, I'm Kevin Smith. I've, I've directed "Clerks" and "Mall Rats" and "Chasing Amy".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And that's why you're here. To discuss my movie.

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: Um, I guess I should, I should pitch you something, huh? Are you up for that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm up for sittin' by the pool and watchin' the jack roll in.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looks at Zorak) Squirrels don't win awards. Stupid squirrel.

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: Zorak! (makes thumb-forefinger-pinky gestures with both hands)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, Kevin, what's the plan? What now, where to, what's next for the Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: I think you just need to work with the right director. So I'm sure this is boring Zorak, but...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I turned off my ears five minutes ago.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Then how did you know what he said?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I said, if you turned off your ears, how did you know what Kevin said?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I said, if you turned, did you say "turned off"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I said, if you turned off your ears, how did you know what Kevin said?

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: No, I, I didn't mean, I was laughing with you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But I wasn't laughing, was I?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, it's all settled then. Now I have a contract drawn up for you to direct my movie. All you need to do is sign it, and then go away.

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: I'd be up for that. I'd, I'd sign a waiver.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Actually, it's a little more binding than a waiver. It's more like a trap. So, if you could just go ahead and sign that, we'll begin principle photography in, what, say, ten minutes?

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: You are takin' care of business, he is takin' care of business, Zorak, isn't he?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (transformed into a squirrel) (blinks) Screwy, ain't it?

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: Never mind the big bug bust-the-power-band move.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Listen, Kevin, if you're not going to take this seriously...

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: I've got a question now, where is, where is the monkey?

transcript.speaker: Kevin Smith
transcript.dialogue: Monkey can't get a break in this business.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Cue fire. (throws lever, Kevin is enveloped in flames)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty. Please say hello to my last and final guest, Jim Jarmusch.

transcript.speaker: Jim Jarmusch
transcript.dialogue: I'm really happy to be here, but I'm a little confused, because I, uh... (flames leap up around jim) Uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, quit horsin' around, Moltar, you're embarrassing me. (flames subside)

transcript.speaker: Jim Jarmusch
transcript.dialogue: That's better, thanks. The last thing I remember was I was asleep at home in my bed, and then there was this really intense white light, that...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes. Then, the depression and guilt.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't need to tell you that. (beat) Out loud. (beat) Meeting.

transcript.speaker: Jim Jarmusch
transcript.dialogue: Hey, could I say 'hi' to some of my friends in the cartoon world? (Quickdraw McGraw walks by) 'Cause I've never been, like, in cartoon land before.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: How ya doin' there, pardner? Hup, see ya later.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Actually, Jim, I - (falls through trap door again) Aaaaaaaaaaaa...

transcript.speaker: Jim Jarmusch
transcript.dialogue: You could, like, grow an extra head or, you know, die and come back to life, or, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry, Jim, but we're in a hurry, and the only reason you're here is that you're a director. So, help me or leave.

transcript.speaker: Jim Jarmusch
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I, I, uh... What's up with Zorak, is he, uh, he's like some kind of outer space grasshopper or something?

transcript.speaker: Jim Jarmusch
transcript.dialogue: Is he related, is he, like, the evil twin of Jiminy Cricket? You know, the...

transcript.speaker: Jim Jarmusch
transcript.dialogue: And another thing I wanted to ask you, now, why do you superheroes, like, wear your underwear on the outside of your pants?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aw heck, I'll just direct it myself.
